publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5115 Richard Lochhead: Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the new £1 million development in Speyside by Edrington, owners of The Macallan single malt, which includes a new visitor centre and the restored 18th century Jacobean manor, Easter Elchies House; congratulates Edrington on the growth of The Macallan which has increased sales at three times the rate of the single malt market over the last five years, and recognises the important role that whisky plays in the manufacturing, transportation and tourism industries in Moray and across Scotland, resulting in whisky contributing £2 billion a year to the balance of trade.

S2M-5115 Richard Lochhead: Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of the new £1 million development in Speyside by Edrington, owners of The Macallan single malt, which includes a new visitor centre and the restored 18th century Jacobean manor, Easter Elchies House; congratulates Edrington on the growth of The Macallan which has increased sales at three times the rate of the single malt market over the last five years, and recognises the important role that whisky plays in the manufacturing, transportation and tourism industries in Moray and across Scotland, resulting in whisky contributing £2 billion a year to the balance of trade. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Ms Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-5115 Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside (lodged on 8 November 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*, Eleanor Scott*, Phil Gallie*, Jim Mather*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S2M-5115 Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside (lodged on 8 November 2006) Bruce Crawford*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5115 Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside (lodged on 8 November 2006) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-5115 Opening of The Macallan Whisky Development in Speyside (lodged on 8 November 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
